website_summaries.verdict: Like Canon's other printers in its Pixma MX-series, the stylish MX870 has versatile features, including a handy scroll wheel and an ample 2.5-inch LCD, to help you get the job done. We recommend the Canon Pixma MX870 as a do-it-all device with an affordable price tag; just be ready to stomach its intermittent print lag.
cons: Output speed prone to intermittent lags

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: This is a means to sell overpriced ink. If you want a fax machine that won't send a fax because it is out of magenta ink, this is the printer for you. If you want a printer that won't print in black and white because it is out of magenta ink, this is the printer for you. If you want a machine that totally shuts down because it is out of magenta ink (although you really only ever use the black ink and have it set for grayscale), this is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well here we are at over ten years later.
customer_reviews.text: It used paper and ink in those 10 years and still works great. The scan to PC requires setup that I won't bother with so I scan to some USB memory stick now. The photocopy feature doesn't use a PC which is a really great to have feature. The FAX feature has saved me a few trips to the copy shop too. About all I've done over time is to gently vacuum up the paper dust and bits, add paper and ink.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Canon knows it printers
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer since January 2011; it was the best decision. I've never had a single problem with it. When it does finally go, I will purchase another canon printer. Color quality is excellent. Scanning is pretty simple. The wireless feature means I can print from other devices and from nearly anywhere. It a bit outdated now but it for my purpose it still works great. I was able to set up google cloud print with it. I can fax, print pictures. Basically, you can do anything you need to do with it.
customer_reviews.author: LubDub

customer_reviews.title: I'm so very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this almost ten years ago and it's still working perfectly. I'm so very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: pauline morgan

customer_reviews.title: Byebye HP, helloooo Canon!
customer_reviews.text: Some clever design features on this excellent printer, not the least of which is the solid-in-repose top that won't break when my cat jumps on it. Easy to set up, when I paid careful attention. Very satisfactory print quality. And the fax is so fast and easy, I actually sent my first fax three times because it went _so_ fast, I thought it hadn't transmitted after all! I bought the MX870 based on the reviews after spending two hours on customer service chat with HP, pleasant but not useful in fixing my second 4-in-1 to break down on only its second cartridge. Can't believe it took so long to wean me off HP, but glad I finally smartened up.
customer_reviews.author: AZ ReaderTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Canon has lost a customer thanks to this machine
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item in 2011. I've had two print head errors since purchasing. I'm not a heavy printer and rarely print in color. I'm very disappointed in this product and cannot recommend. Our old black/white HP never failed us in the way the Canon has. I'm currently in the midst of our third print head failure and hoping to "fix" it again and get some additional use out of this product. This item seems to be designed for planned obsolescence and Canon has lost me as a customer.
customer_reviews.author: Karla Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Creates smudges on pages through paperfeed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer in protest of the HP printers that had become increasingly unreliable due to noisy and unstable carriages. This Canon MX870 does not produce crisp pages, but my biggest complaint is that when printing, copying or scanning with the paper feed tray (ADF), the output pages have multiple lines through them. I have tried cleaning the printer using the utilites from Canon and nothing works. Pages are still not clear unless you copy directly from the platen. I am hesitant to buy another Canon. whatever happened to reliable products at an affordable price?
customer_reviews.author: J. Perry

customer_reviews.title: EASY Mac/Leopard setup!
customer_reviews.text: I specifically purchased this b/c of great Mac-related reviews - I have multiple Macs running osx 10.5. Not disappointed! I've struggled for years with Epson printers that didn't play nicely with the Macs and in 15 minutes had the entire office printing to the Canon. Setup, maintenance and settings are all intuitive and best of all, everything just works. Right out of the box. Another bonus: The number of features on this are amazing at the price point. Photo quality is excellent - slightly less crisp than the Epson but then all of the other drawbacks to the Epson make this the clear winner. A++
customer_reviews.author: N. Heckmann

customer_reviews.title: Thought it would be better
customer_reviews.text: Prints well but that's about it. I don't need some of the functions this thing has it it seems full featured. One thing that is positively abysmal is the size of the paper tray. It doesn't hold much at all. If you have much printing to do of get numerous faxes while away this is a pain. Another problem is this thing refuses to work with my wireless router. I long ago gave up trying to get to work right. I do like the easy of cartridge change and the ink does seem to last.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: 1st 6 Weeks...
customer_reviews.text: Review is written 6 wks after purchase. My last all-in-one was Canon PIXMA MP 530 Pro: 1. Easy setup-including installation of print-head 2. Multiple copies can be made easily 3. Clear, gray-scale, text print Con: 1. Initial printing warm-up is longer than usual 2. Individual ink cartridges are very, very small; however, you only need to replace the specific color needed Have not tried other features to date; however, I am already convinced it is a much, much better product than the PIXMA MP 530
customer_reviews.author: cedarhurst

customer_reviews.title: PGBK stop working, unable print documents
customer_reviews.text: PGBK line stop printing, cleaned everything but no luck. Everything else works but I cannot print documents with black ink... I did not use this printer much and the fact that everything else works scanner and printing pictures ,drive me crazy because 90% of the things I print are documents.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Stewy

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating
customer_reviews.text: I've owned my MX870 for about a year and a half. It's been 18 months of frustration. Wireless printing frequently fails to work. I often get a message that there is no wireless connection and I have to go and turn the printer off and turn it back on again. Sometimes, I have to unplug it and plug it back in as well. Then when I go to use it, I get an error message telling me it was unplugged while printing, which it wasn't. As mentioned by other reviewers, it uses a lot of ink and is expensive to operate. I wish I had returned it.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: was good at the time.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. With age the quality dropped. Currently looking for somthing more upto date.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: MX870
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Print, copy, fax all work. Setup had one glitch that cured itself in a couple of days (initially it killed the print spooler and wouldn't work at all, then started to, more or less spontaneously) On photo print, first print looked fine except for a fine reddish edge along upper edges. I aligned it, using the process in the electronic manual (would have preferred a printed manual)and the second print seems better. Scan produces only pdf file, so you can't edit it unless you buy the larger version of Adobe Acrobat, which is a sort of irritating bundle job. Much larger than my previous printer, but I knew that when I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: capnjack

customer_reviews.title: Does everything I need
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had this long so I don't know how the ink usage will be, but I am so far delighted with my purchase. I wanted a wireless printer/scanner/FAX and so far this Cannon does it all without needless complexity. Setup was fairly easy and there are good instructions including a trouble shooting guide. The instruction manual is very clear and detailed, but most things have been so intuitive I didn't have to look at the manual - to figure out how to scan for example. Print speed is fine, performance exceeds my expectations for a printer/combo at this price. Highly recommended for home office/all around printer.
customer_reviews.author: S in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Sucks up Ink
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice printer and a few people told me they like Canon because of the separate cartridges for each color. What I didn't expect is that this printer is a real ink hog and the cartridges aren't cheap. I am about to spend another $80 for a 3 pack of black and a single cartridge each of the other colors. They all run out about the same time. If you don't mind spending $80 every couple of months on ink, get this printer. The printing is nice quality and it's convenient to have a wireless printer. The reviews of generic ink for this printer don't encourage me to try that either.
customer_reviews.author: Blondie

customer_reviews.title: Home office powerhouse and even works with Linux over the network
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely awesome. I have this unit operating as a network printer, but you can also access the scan and fax functions over the network. Excellent color and BW print quality (I haven't tried photo printing). A very fast fax, but there are only 3 one-button speed dials (more are accessible through the keypad). Relatively quiet, but not something I would use while someone was sleeping in the same room. This unit will also work over the network with openSUSE 11.2/Linux, but you have to download the driver from Canon's European servers (Google around and you'll find it; ignore anything that says there's no driver).
customer_reviews.author: intelligo

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, very happy
customer_reviews.text: My computer geek boyfriend and I did alot of research and were surprised how much this one does for the price! It's hooked up to my desktop and wirelessly to my laptop. Did a ton of wireless printing on it for my online courses, worked every time, there was a comment about having to reset every time, I did not have that problem, maybe settings. Ink lasted longer than I thought it would, still original ink despite all that printing. Faxed fine too. Haven't done pictures yet. Watch the measurements, it is fairly large. I wish it would turn on wirelessly too. :)
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Home Printer & Scanner & Fax & Photocopier
customer_reviews.text: This product is an excellent printer & scanner & Photocopier and fax for home usage. It is a little slow compared to other possible laser and office printers, however if you are going to use this in your house, then it should be okay. PROs: - Duplex printing: Automatic double page printing is excellent! - WIFI Printing (works great with my mac book pro) - Elegant Design - All in one: Printer and Scanner, Fax and Photocopier - High Quality Image printing (especially on photo papers) CONs: - The cartridge is a little expensive compared to the printer (it is $55 on electronic stores and $45 on Amazon.com) Still I think you can't get better for this price. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Kivanc Muslu

customer_reviews.title: Good printer
customer_reviews.text: Once I got over the initial shock of the size of this printer (it is much bigger than the hp 5610 that I had previously), I have been happy with its performance. I haven't used it much so it is hard for me to evaluate it thoroughly, but I can say that the wireless feature works flawlessly with both Windows 7 and Vista once you get the system set up. However, I could have saved myself hours of troubleshooting had I realized that if I installed the printer to connect by USB, it will not also install to work by wireless on the same computer.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jane

customer_reviews.title: this is one of my all time favorite printing machines
customer_reviews.text: this is one of my all time favorite printing machines, and I do a lot of printing (I am a photographer and I sell my own prints and this makes great one). I also like that it will print on heavier card stock (I make greeting cards) and of course does all the day-to0day stuff as well. This is a replacement 870 for one that died and I hope I can get another one just like it in another 5 or 6 years when this one gives up the ghost for my brutal over-use.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Exellent All-in-one, except can't scan Black & White (not grey scale)
customer_reviews.text: The Canon PIXMA MX870 is an excellent all-in-one color printer. I just have one issue, it can scan Color and Grey-scale, but not Black & White. Scanning 10 pages of document in grey-scale and convert them to PDF, the PDF file is very large size, more than 10MB. This prevent us from using it to scan documents for sending via e-mail. I have an old Brother MFC9420CN all-in-one printer, which allow scanning to Black & White, the scanned image is very clear (each pixel is either black or white), and small file size to package as PDF to send by e-mail.
customer_reviews.author: HLie

customer_reviews.title: Intermittently wireless printer
customer_reviews.text: I like almost everything about the operation of the printer. However, the reason I bought THIS one is because of the wireless connectivity. One room away, about 30 feet, my second computer station has to be re-initialized at least twice a week. For some reason, the software drops its recognition of this signal almost at random. Very frustrating. If I had more gumption, I'd return the product, but the thought of wrapping it all up again (I've tossed the original box, etc.) leads me to frequently re-boot the connection. Not what I expected!
customer_reviews.author: KiawahPoppa

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Great printer for the money!!
customer_reviews.text: I set out to find the best printer soley based on Amazon's customer reviews and popularity numbers. Wow, this printer truly is a great value for the price! I love that it can print on both sides, and scans dual sides also. I haven't had any bugs or kinks as of yet, everything seems to be working great! My only complaint is that you have to install the canon software on your computer before you can receive scans. My old printer didn't need special software, I could use the scanner service that was built into windows. Otherwise, everything is really good!
customer_reviews.author: Sean Ong

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse printer, excellent OEM cartridges
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my second MX870, printing thousands of sheets a year. Love this printer. Reliable and simple to use. Single and double sided Particularly love the oem cartridges, only a few dollars for a full set. Scanner works well to even with auto feed for the top tray Not a bad thing to say. I'd buy this again, rather than one of the later models as I know rhe OEM crushes will work, and that's a major saving
customer_reviews.author: Colin Jones

customer_reviews.title: DRINKS INK LIKE CRAZY!
customer_reviews.text: This printer does an excellent job of printing. It's drawback is that it drinks ink like crazy and the ink cartridges are quite pricey. The unit itself is pretty large for household use, but I really don't mind it's sitting on my dining room table since I don't use the table very often. The price was reasonable. I've owned it for about three years now and have had no mechanical problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth A. CARRAWAY

customer_reviews.title: Superior Printer/Scanner/Copier/Fax
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from HP PhotoSmart 2610 to this Multi-Function Machine. Have done a lot of research on the internet, I decided to go with this one -- Amazon ships compatible cartridges for this machine. I've been very happy about this machine. It is so easy to install and use it. It saved a lot of time. So far I've used the following features: printer (print in single/doule page modes through wifi), scanner, copier, fax. It works reliably. The software installs in Windows 7 easily, and the user interface is pretty intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: R. Zou

customer_reviews.title: Not just a printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I needed a scanner. The fact that it was wireless was terrific because I could put it anywhere in the room and not have to trip over another wire. I could have my desktop and laptop connected to the same printer without wires. It also faxes but I don't have that set up. It was not so easy to set up. My computer professional friend set it up for me. But it works. The printing and scanning is fast. The clarity is excellent. I tried printing a few photos which is something I rarely do. I liked the results.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Printer is awesome slight issues with Apple products
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for over a month now and I am very happy with it. It was easy to set up the WI-FI printing and took less than a half hour to set up the printer and to install the print drivers on my Mac and PC computers. Cost of printing is relatively cheap as welll. My major complaint is when I started printing off of my iPad I lost communication with the printer on my Mac and it was a huge ordeal to be able to print again from it. It involves either not allowing my mother to print from her PC or I can't print from my iPad. Huge pain!
customer_reviews.author: Sterling Style

customer_reviews.title: After quality print was poor, ink repeatedly had to be changed connections were ...
customer_reviews.text: Machine does not last very long. Constantly have to replace ink. Ink is cheap. Ordered three of these worked for about a year and 1/2 at most. After quality print was poor, ink repeatedly had to be changed connections were constantly disrupted. Repeatedly had to network trouble shoot.
customer_reviews.author: MSU IUR

customer_reviews.title: Very good and reliable printer, but not professional grade
customer_reviews.text: Have owned this printer for a few years now. It does print and scan some nice things, the wifi feature is awesome and I prefer having the colors broken down into multiple cartridges. My wife is planning on starting a photography business, so we were hoping we could use this printer, but unfortunately you can see lines in the pictures you print no matter the quality. Overall, it's an excellent printer, but not if you want to have a photography business
customer_reviews.author: M. Matias

customer_reviews.title: Good machine, recommend
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for over 5 years. It uses ink up pretty quick and ink can dry out when not in use for awhile, but overall this is a great little printer etc... The photo prints are nice and clear, the color ink prints are also. I really this this model, and enjoy the wifi feature. All of our phones and computers can be linked to this and utilize it for printing, anywhere in the house, with wifi router.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer is awesome. Very easy to setup wireless connection and print quality is great. I just bought a packet of all 5 ink cartigage for $10.00. Can't beat that price anywhere. The old saying of you get what you pay for is very true with this printer. If you want a 40-50 dollar printer you will pay for it with outrages ink cost and poor print quality. But if you want a great printer that won't cost you a leg and an arm for ink and super print quality then this is the printer. For the money you can't beat it!!
customer_reviews.author: Javlin3

customer_reviews.title: Very good all in one
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for about 2 months and I have to say it is nearly flawless. The print quality is very good, the photo quality is outstanding in comparison to any other all in one I've used or seen. The copy quality is excellent, a bit slow, but fast enough. The scanning is quite good too. So far I've printed a good deal of material and still haven't had to replace any ink cartridges. The dual paper feed is nice and it knows which one to use. Canon hit a home run with this printer. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Mark F. Kitson

customer_reviews.title: mx870
customer_reviews.text: Works as well as my other 2 mx860 particularly like th internet printing feature allowing one to print from web pages not always an easy thing to do. Would highly recommed. Individual ink cartridges is a definite plus. Still learning features I never knew existed. Prints graph paper among other specialty things. ONe should grab manual and learn all it can do. wifi printing another definite plus. Scanner works like a dream. Like the auto feed for document scanning into say adobe professional 7 to create large documents.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent low priced multifunction printer
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent easy to set up multifunction printer for sharing on a wireless network. It was fast and easy to set up, and produces very good prints and photos. It scans and copies much faster than my previous scanner. It is not an extremely fast printer, but is not slow enough to be a problem. My only negative impression is that it uses ink faster than my other printers have. It is easy to manage the ink, however, because of the multiple ink cartridges and the ink monitor feature. Ink cartridges seem to be more reasonably priced, also, than some other brands. Overall, I am very happy with this printer and my Amazon purchase process.
customer_reviews.author: Raster

customer_reviews.title: One problem after another
customer_reviews.text: This printer has been the worst printer I have ever owned. The problems include multiple occurrences of each of the following: dropping off the wired home network which requires turning the printer off and on, paper misfeeds in the main paper tray, and jammed print heads that do not clear with the "clean print heads" function. Even though this printer is highly rated by others, my experience has been terrible on many levels.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Canon wireless printer
customer_reviews.text: My complaint is with the difficulty to set up the wireless function. It took 2 of us many frustrating hours on the telephone on 2 occasions to connect laptops for wireless use. I think one problem was a firewall which the support might have directed us to temporarily disconnect if needed. My fiance was ready to throw it out before we finally had success. Since then, I have been very happy w the performance of printing. I have not tried the other features yet.
customer_reviews.author: P. M. Young

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I have notoriously bad luck with printers. I buy them...they break. But not this printer! It is still going strong after almost two years! It is very easy to operate and maintain. The ink is easy to replace and the paper is very easy to refill. I have printed labels, envelopes, pictures, you name it. I would absolutely recommend this printer!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Travis

customer_reviews.title: Better value than comparably priced HP
customer_reviews.text: Got this after my old HP J6450 died (which I really liked) and was sorely disappointed by the J6500. Although this Canon has a large footprint, it is very well built (unlike even my old J6450 the duplexer here never jams, for instance), has more features (like an auto feeder that allows for two-sided scanning/copying) and is comparable if slightly inferior in terms of ease of setup and use (customer service tho is great). and while i am not an intense user, i have not noticed any difference in ink usage vs my HP's. In short, if the footprint works for you, it's good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: G. Eyre

customer_reviews.title: Good printer for the cost
customer_reviews.text: This all-in-one printer is an attractive and well functioning machine. The printer's size is just right for my needs (small business). The print quality is good, and the print time is adequate, especially for the price point. The only negative from my standpoint is that the mechanical setup is not extremely easy. The directions are good, but it took me 30-40 minutes to work through it. At first, I was not able to establish connection through Wi-Fi. I'm not terribly facile with technology, and I didn't understand much of the "techie" terminology. I gave up and hired a computer expert who got my printer up and running in about one hour.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Noel

customer_reviews.title: Good printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer. I ordered it because of a review of printers in Consumer Reports. It's big but very functional. I really like the scanning software that comes with it. I mainly use the scanner for getting images of postcards I sell on-line. I don't print a lot, but so far the ink has been holding up well. The pictures I print come out great. I haven't had any problems with it. I haven't tried the fax, but that should work well too. The automatic sheet feeder worked well when I tested it. Another good thing is the fact you can print on both sides of the paper. Overall, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Runte

customer_reviews.title: Although the high cost of its ink is a blot on this printer/scanner/copier/fax, it's easy to operate and does whatever you ask.
customer_reviews.text: Although this printer drinks expensive ink like a blotter, it performs well. Its onscreen manual is very well organized and makes everything very simple. The one problem I have is the paper tray, which never wants to return to its loading bay. It's a matter of pushing and pulling until it gives up and glides in, with an almost audible sigh. I found that inexpensive generic ink, rather than the manufacturer's label, saves a lot of money.
customer_reviews.author: Gliocas

customer_reviews.title: This is the best printer for the price - well worth it for home use
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the best printer I've bought. The Wifi function is easy to set up unlike other printers. It works seamlessly from a Mac which is good ! The scanner is superb. Print quality is superb, although the printer is a bit slow. The copy function is fantastic and has saved many trips to Kinkos. I'm not sure how long the ink will last or how much it will cost to replace, which might change my opinion about this printer :) But for the money, I think this is an excellent buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Canon PIXMA MX870
customer_reviews.text: Received my printer very quickly after ordering. This is my first Canon. I previously had several HP's but after having a hard time with support and having them break so easily I decided to change. The only thing I notice with this printer is it is a little slow to start up the printing. Once it starts it's faster than the printer I previously had. I like the duplexing feature and it scans quickly and the quality is great! Looking forward to my experience with Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Gail B

customer_reviews.title: Good copier, poor picture printing
customer_reviews.text: Generally satisfied with the printer, good functions. A little slow, and the picture printing quality poor, no matter what adjustments I made for clarity. I have a very stable connection for it's WI FI connection, unlike with the brand it replaced. Easy on screen set up instructions but the menu on the printer could be made a little easier and more expanded.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this or any other Canon printer - it ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this or any other Canon printer - it has a defect that will cause an error code that will disable all of the functions of the printer. The error code is the U052 code about the print head. Canon has instructions on their website to fix the error, but after following the instructions the error code was still there. I can't print, copy or scan now and from the information I have read on the Canon Forum at  this is a long standing problem for several other Canon printer models. It will cost more to repair the print head than to just buy a new printer.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bridges

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT PRINTER!!!
customer_reviews.text: This printer had everything I wanted. 2-sided printing, continous printing after one color is empty, ADF, photo printing, inserts memory cards. It took 15 mins to setup w/verizon internet. The only con I have is the size, a little large, but I didn't care because it had everything I needed. Only home use for copying homework and documents off the internet. I have only replaced the ink ONCE since I bought printer. I love this printer. No issues!!
customer_reviews.author: mother of  four

customer_reviews.title: Canon PIXMA MX870 Printer
customer_reviews.text: Canon PIXMA MX870 Wireless All-In-One Printer arrived on time and in good condition. I would buy from Tiger King again, and would recommend this vendor to others. The product works great, and is very user friendly. We also have a Canon PIXMA MX860, both printers use the same ink cartridges which makes it easier to buy ink, as I can buy them in bulk and save money. I would recommend this little printer for home or office use.
customer_reviews.author: Janil

customer_reviews.title: simplifies my life
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup on both our laptops -- one uses XP and the other Windows 7. I chose to hide it in a closet, so it is right where I want it, but not taking up display space in my home. My only minor compliants are how long it takes for the setup process and how long it takes for prints to travel, format and appear. Love the option of double sided prints. I have used it to generate custom photo greeting cards -- I'm pleased with the quality on my specialty papers.
customer_reviews.author: T. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Will never buy Cannon again.
customer_reviews.text: Got this printer after our two HP printers died with in a few weeks of each other. Had this printer about a month now and we really like it. It is the easiest printer I have ever set up. The WiFi connection work great and lets you put the printer anywhere you want. I have always had HP printers but never again. EDIT on 10/13/11 After 5 months The machine is dead. It didn't even run out the factory set of ink cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: Henry H.

customer_reviews.title: Inks dry out
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer in January 2011. I have another black and white laser printer, so I use this printer mostly for scanning, copying, and once in a while color printings. The thing that disappoint me is that the color ink cartridges always dry out, even without use. Since I only occasionally do the color printing, I ended up spending about 40 dollars to buy new color cartridges every time I want to print out color. It is more economical to get the print job done at Staples. I think it is time to find a more economical printer.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: $550??? I paid $140 4 years ago.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for 4 years and besides a few minor glitches (print by WiFi doesn't work) and it gobbling colored ink when I don't print anything in color, it's been pretty reliable and does a good job for the $140 I paid for it. But $550??? no way would I pay that much to buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: T. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer--If and when it works; seems to have Mac problems
customer_reviews.text: This printer works really well--when it wants to. I use a Mac computer and it seems like every fourth print job I send to the Canon turns into a "Communications Error" with no printing. And it's not just me: Google the phrase "870 communications error" and see how many support groups and threads there are. If you use a Mac and if immediate reliability is an issue, this printer is a problem. If you can spend the time re-setting it and unplugging it, then it works pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: ReaderInTheMiddle

customer_reviews.title: If your as sick of your HP's as I am, Get one of these - you'll love it.
customer_reviews.text: I have had both Cannon & HP. My HP was difficult to set-up, use, drank ink like a vampire, wouldn't interface via wifi to my HP desktop nor my Sony laptop, and software asking me to participate in some lame survey every week. I have been very impressed w/ Cannon. Easy set up, easy use, haven't had to change color catridges yet, & interfaces w/ all my home computers via wifi. I even bought one for my office at work.
customer_reviews.author: prattcarioca

customer_reviews.title: HP Convert
customer_reviews.text: I've been an HP customer and shareholder for many years but this time I decided to try Canon's PIXMA MX870. I'm glad I did. The setup was easy and the connectivity with 3 different computers was accomplished without a hitch. Instructions were clear and complete and the print quality is great. At the time of purchase, the best price available was through Amazon...there are several other stores who will gladly accept more from you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I liked the Canon MX870 Printer
customer_reviews.text: I liked the Canon MX870 Printer and I did use and purchase two MX870 printers. However I have upgraded now to a Canon MX922 Printer which are currently selling as expectional value. Now I have two MX992 printers and I like the MX 992 even better than the MX870.
customer_reviews.author: Happy_Superman

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what I'm doing wrong.
customer_reviews.text: One star rating. I have to turn the printer and/or my computer off and on almost every time I want to print or scan. What a pain. I have not idea what I have done wrong to make this happen. I have reinstalled software and reset printer with no improvement of results. I would throw in in the garbage and get something else if I wasnt afraid it would happen all over again. I did find that the $5.00 ink set sold by Amazon works great.
customer_reviews.author: NSqr

customer_reviews.title: Canon MX870
customer_reviews.text: Set up out of the box was easy and fast. Print quality good. Used customer support for Fax receiving because instuctions were not clear that when using a common phone line for voice and fax, a corded phone must be attached to printer, and when phone rings, pick-up receiver, listen for fax tone, press start, then hang up receiver. Ink useage seems to be OK. I like the fact that it can use non-OEM ink. Paper supply tray a little smaller than I expected, but adequate for occasional use. All on all, I am happy with this printer.
customer_reviews.author: D. Root

customer_reviews.title: Extremely well designed
customer_reviews.text: It's rare when you find a product that reliably lives up to it's potential. I've had this printer for over almost a year, and it's one of the best technology products I have ever purchased. The Wifi was easy to setup. It does everything well... print, scan, copy. Has a straight-through feed for thicker card stock. Getting the scanning to upload to your computer can sometimes be a challenge, but that's a windows firewall issue.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Sure beats HP
customer_reviews.text: I have in the past have always been an HP printer guy, but got tired of them not holding up and excessive ink usage. This canon model has been the best by far and in my opinion is far superior to any HP in quality and ink usage. It just works all the time and never jams plus prints right now, no going out to lunch waiting for a printer to print here. Click print and it's there now, no thinking about for this printer.
customer_reviews.author: toodaloo

customer_reviews.title: LOVE MY CANNON PRINTERS
customer_reviews.text: Ok loved my Cannon PIXMA870 a d had it for a long time. I have now replaced it with another Cannon PIXMA MX922 AND I LOVE IT TOO!!
customer_reviews.author: Puffer Fish 62

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer now for 4 years and love it. Haven't had any problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Geester

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: I have had several Cannon printers over the last 8 years. This is the third. It was extremely easy to set up and install. Print quality is above board...top notch. The feature that I enjoy the most is double page print. I don't have to take the printed pages and flip them around to print on the back. For a home printer, this is a great feature, and for the price I paid...this is a great printer.
customer_reviews.author: Gary T.

customer_reviews.title: We liked it so much we bought 2 more
customer_reviews.text: We had one for about 3 months, we worked it so well we bought 2 more. Only thing, it goes through the 2 black cartridges (#220 and 221's) really quickly. We will eventually buy a laser printer (we have a doctors office) buy saved money initially to get up and running. A very solid work horse, also love the wireless capabilities, it really is a time saver.
customer_reviews.author: The Wes Guy

customer_reviews.title: We have owned several Canon printers and this one has ...
customer_reviews.text: We have owned several Canon printers and this one has by far lasted the longest. We started out using it daily in our small business and have since moved it home to use for homeschool. 6 years later it is still going strong. We use "compatible" generic ink cartridges to save money and have had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: HokieJ

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: This printer has handled everything I have tried with it very well. I have scanned and printed quite a few pictures, and scanned some documents. The onboard controls are very intuitive, and it was very easy to set up. I connected it to my wireless network without a hitch. I haven't had to look at the manual since I got it installed, because everything is so intuitive. The photo printing software is also nice. It scans multiple small photos at once and automatically crops each one to a separate file. It was pretty easy to find cheap replacement ink that works very well. It prints great quality photos. I'm very happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: David Strother

customer_reviews.title: Still Going Strong!
customer_reviews.text: Hope I didn't jinx myself, but this AIO printer rocks! Best feature is the duplexing. Would rate this overall 4.5 stars because of sporadic disconnection from my Mac running OS X Mavericks and weird Canon software. Otherwise, this has almost flawlessly met my printing and scanning needs.
customer_reviews.author: winemac

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for the scanner and fax combo
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the fax and scanner, not really to print much. Both work well. I've scanned and saved about 300 pages of docs as I move to a paperless office and the auto-feeder works well. Printing is a bit slow and people comment that the ink dries up quickly -but as I said this is not something I do much. In fact I have a Brother 2170W laser printer for my B&W print jobs I bought on Amazon for about $100.
customer_reviews.author: Steven D. Greenwood

customer_reviews.title: So far it's working okay which makes me happy because I love the Canon MX870 Printers because I ...
customer_reviews.text: Buying a used item is always a concern will it work and how long will it work for the price you pay for it. So far it's working okay which makes me happy because I love the Canon MX870 Printers because I refill my ink cartridges myself and the cartridges allow you to see when they are getting low not like the new Canon printers (which is sad) The printer looked used but like I said so far its working fine so makes me happy but time will tell if I get my money's worth out of it.
customer_reviews.author: K . Markley

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer, Scanner, Copier
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how far they've come with printers- just printing double sided is amazing- and copying double sided or scanning! Love the iPhone print feature although I haven't even printed any photos on photo paper yet- ink goes kinda quick but its a lot cheaper to replace than the old machines. Love everything about it- It's big though, so you need a good footprint or side table.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M. Kaplan

customer_reviews.title: Nice all in one printer
customer_reviews.text: Have used the printer for only week. I love it! This printer does all its meant to do. The set up took me some time. Had to go over the manual to get the fax settings right. The best part is the wireless setting. I can send stuff to print from my laptop. I have tried scanning and copying, and all works fine. Its a large size printer and a little heavy, but that does not bother me. I will recommend this printer for all its capability and the price.
customer_reviews.author: BeingHonest

customer_reviews.title: Feature rich printer
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this as a gift for my wife and she loves it. My eleven year old helped her with the setup and even though he's a genius, the instructions and ease of setup worked fine. The wireless feature is a real time saver and more than compensates for any complaints from other reviews about slower than normal initial warm-up times. Scanning and print quality are very good and fast enough for home use. The only thing we noticed was with older photos, the scanned image colors can be a little off hue. Amazon as usual helped with non-biased reviews, fast shipping, and great customer support.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn A. Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be better
customer_reviews.text: The Good: Print quality is good. Wireless is very convenient for printing from multiple computers. Duplex scanning is great. The Bad: Can't send faxes directly from a Mac. Can't send scans directly to computer from printer (you must use the interface from the computer which makes no sense). Couldn't print various different PDF files from a flash drive (says file type not supported or file too large).
customer_reviews.author: Skyler Kogachi

customer_reviews.title: Great Home AIO
customer_reviews.text: This printer was very easy to install - I have 2 laptops at home (Windows and Mac) and I was able to whiz through the set up process. Print quality is very good - The lid that must be lifted for the scanner is delicate, handle with care opening and closing - I have not tried to fax documents - I utilize the wifi option and can print from anywhere in my townhouse Great buy for the money
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: So Happy I bought it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer less than 2 weeks ago for my home. So far everything is awesome. Set-up was super easy. Scanning works great. Printing is fast and high quality. I love the wireless connectivity. Since it is slightly larger than my old printer I had to find a new place to set it, and with the WiFi, I can put it anywhere with a plug. Since it is new, I have no idea how the ink life will be. I know that I do like the individual color cartridges, that should help maximize the ink usage. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Neal J. Gerdeman

customer_reviews.title: Self-Destructive Product!
customer_reviews.text: This printer completely stopped functioning suddenly after 15 months. According to the Canon service tech, essentially if you don't keep buying new ink, it is programmed to self-destruct. Apparently, not having fresh ink cartridges causes the print head circuit to dry out. He said it would be cheaper to buy a new print than to replace the part.
customer_reviews.author: DKR5

customer_reviews.title: ... this printer after almost five years and it work great still to this day
customer_reviews.text: I still own this printer after almost five years and it work great still to this day. I have asked a lot out of it, but it works predictably and smoothly everytime. Rarely a jam to be spoken of. Excellet buy.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal H.

customer_reviews.title: Wow, that was easy!
customer_reviews.text: If you're on the fence about this printer let me put your mind at ease. Great price, simple to install, great printing. I unpacked, installed and printed a document within 15 minutes. Others have had difficulty loading the software but our laptops (both PC and Mac) had zero problems with the Easy Install direction. This was so easy, I had to write a review so you weren't frightened by some of the less positive reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Little

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: Love this printer, so easy to install on my computer and adds the manual when you initially set it up. Its nice looking and all of the functions are very easy to use. It is a bit slow printing, but this does not really matter to me. I am very happy that I selected this printer. It helped by looking at the reviews on various printers and was able to select the one that was suited to me.
customer_reviews.author: Kath

customer_reviews.title: Best Printer for the $$
customer_reviews.text: I am an HP fan but due to the cost of ink, I decided to go with the Cannon MX870. It was easy to set up. I had it connected to all my pc's as well as my iPad. The print speed isn't as fast I had thought but the quality makes it worth the wait. Don't get me wrong, it's not slow just not fast. I would recommend this printer if you are looking for an All-In-One. Price was good for the product you receive.
customer_reviews.author: Cricket H

customer_reviews.title: ADF works surprisingly well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this model specificly for the auto document feed to try to get out from under the piles of paper. My first test of the ADF I thought surely would fail. I had a stack of articles from a trade journal I wanted to keep as PDFs. Slick thin magazine paper, some with torn edges from being ripped from the journal. I was amazed when these fed and scanned without a hiccup. I'm very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: invzbldog

customer_reviews.title: Eats ink, then broke
customer_reviews.text: Printer worked fine for a while then after about 8 months of use, the paper feeder broke and it does not load paper. Inkjets typically use a lot of ink as the cartridges dry out, but these cartridges dry out in less than a month of being installed! Would not recommend this printer. Edit: June 13th 2012 Amazon customer service is awesome, they are working with me to resolve the issue and return the product. A+ for Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: As always, you can trust Canon
customer_reviews.text: I could go on and on about each and every feature of this printer, and comment in detail on the print quality, but it will suffice to say that Canon has produced another fantastic consumer printer. You can buy this printer without concern for ease of use or quality of output. I have two iMac's and two PC's using the printer via WiFi, and there are no issues. I cannot recommend this printer enough.
customer_reviews.author: M. Seina

customer_reviews.title: Good quality all-in-one
customer_reviews.text: The overall quality and functionality for the money is very high. It's great to have an auto document feeder and automatic two sided printing. Menu system is easy enough to use, although a little cumbersome. My last printer had a dedicated print quality button, on the Canon print quality for copying has to be adjusted through the menu. The Canon had no problem making a WiFi connection to my router. The build quality appears to be good, the machine looks attractive, and it does not take up too much space considering all the things that it does. The main black cartridge is on the small side, but replacement cartridges are not that expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Tweaker

customer_reviews.title: Worked until warranty expired.
customer_reviews.text: Found this to be a good product...while it worked. Ceased operation just after the warranty expired. Canon still replaced it for me with no problems. Shouldn't have to replace a printer every year.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher S. Drugan

customer_reviews.title: idiotic reports
customer_reviews.text: this machine will waste multiple sheets of paper and lots of ink printing error reports that cannot be deleted or stopped in any way. You can unplug it, restart it, throw it through the window and it will insist on printing a report even if you hit cancel fifty million times. POS. It mostly works well-the scanner driver though is buggy and requires computer restarts on occasion.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Loving it!
customer_reviews.text: I have previously only bought HP's for the last 10 years. This is my first Canon and I am loving it. Wish I would have switched sooner. Setup was a tiny bit tricky, but fairly well explained in the directions. It was super easy to connect both mine and my husband's laptops to it wirelessly. It has gone through ink a little faster than I would like, but I am printing quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Complex, Complicated, and Fragile Durability
customer_reviews.text: The unit is extremely complex and difficult to get used to. Instruction manual is a disaster and manufacturer support sucks. Printing and copying, including quality color photos was excellent, while it lasted. I never used the FAX function. All printing function suddenly failed prematurely, and finding a repair shop that will attempt repairs has so far been impossible.
customer_reviews.author: AUSTRALOPITHECUS

customer_reviews.title: Customer service is excellent
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this printer, but my comment is mostly about the excellent customer service I received from Canon. When I connected it, I wasn't able to scan from any application or from using the button on the printer. Canon stuck with me for a couple of days to figure out the problem from drivers to reinstalling the software, and several other things. It turned out that the problem was my USB cable. So at their suggestion, I got a new cable and everything works great now. If you're getting a new printer and can't see the difference between two brands, I'd go with Canon in case you run into any problems.
customer_reviews.author: PLC

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, fast printing for a inkjet, fast wireless scanning, inexpensive individual ink tanks that can even be refilled at Costco. Rear paper feeder and cassette both feed well as does the document feeder. Crisp, clean incoming and outgoing faxes. Couldn't ask for more in a multifunction, especially anywhere near this price range. I originally purchased one for a small business environment and was so pleased that I purchased another for my home. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Lonny deBois

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and wireless option
customer_reviews.text: This printer is great quality - the pictures print wonderfully. Also, the wireless setup works great - it's super easy to do. I did have to do it twice, but it could have been something I did, and it's great to be able to easily print from different computers. I've used the scanner for black and white paper documents and it works fine, too!
customer_reviews.author: Ginger

customer_reviews.title: DON"T BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned the MX870 for 9 months and over all it was OK, but for one thing. This printer has 2 black ink tanks and 3 color tanks. If anyone of them goes dry, then the whole printer stops working. No Copys, No Faxing, No Scaning and No card readers. It will just sit in Alarm mode and do nothing. I can't send a fax(NO INK REQUIRD FOR THAT)and I can't scan to my hard drive. If the 2 Black Inks are full and a color tank is empty, you can't even print in Black! I don't like being forced to buy ink to use all the features of my printer, especially the features THAT DON'T REQUIRE INK!!!
customer_reviews.author: Baerwaldt

customer_reviews.title: I recommend you to always use the original Canon Ink
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it for about 5 years and still works perfectly. I recommend you to always use the original Canon Ink, do not waste your money with the cheap ones. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Demirfan

customer_reviews.title: Just what I hoped for!
customer_reviews.text: I tend to like Canon printers and this was no exception. It was easy to set up and link to my wireless network. I like the fact that it has a paper drawer like a more expensive printer. My only complaint, and this seems to be a problem with Canon in general, is the time it takes to print your first page. But if that doesn't annoy you too much I think you'll really like this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa W.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for scanning but horrible in terms of ink life no matter what economic setting you use.
customer_reviews.author: Jorrie Mackenzie

customer_reviews.title: Last 18 Months
customer_reviews.text: This lasted 18 months and then the printer cartridge assembly failed. The cost of replacement was roughly the price of Canon's current machine with similar features. I liked it while it worked, but hated it when it failed. To be fair we have two additional machines that are still working after 20 months.
customer_reviews.author: Mesh

customer_reviews.title: Canon Pixma MX870 Wireless all-in-one printer
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer; it was easy to set up. It was a little tricky putting in the five color ink jets. However, it works perfectly. I have it set up wirelessly with my two computers. whenever I print, the print exit file automatically opens and prints quickly. the copy function works fine. I have not used the photo printing, scan feature or fax capabilities yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still working!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for years and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: The Dog Diva

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for the money
customer_reviews.text: No problems after one year of use. No problems with installation. Goes through ink cartridges quickly but I haven't owned a printer yet that didn't have some degree of frustration with printer ink expense, requiring multiple colors, running out too soon, and/or replacement cartridge availability (to include refill-ability).
customer_reviews.author: profusiac

product_meta.title: Canon PIXMA MX870 Wireless Office All-in-One Printer (4206B002)
product_meta.description:
The PIXMA MX870 Wireless Home Office All-In-One lets you print from any room in your home and boasts incredible 9600 x 2400 maximum color dpi with tiny 1pl ink droplets and a 5 individual ink tank system. A built-in, fully integrated 35-sheet Auto Document Feeder means fast copying or scanning of your originals so you can tend to other tasks while the printer is at work. Its built-in Auto Duplex Printing prints 2-sided documents without having to manually flip the pages and can reduce your paper consumption by 50%. Combine both of those and you can automatically copy two sided documents without having to flip any paper manually at all. Additionally, various security features like password protected PDF’s let you feel safe about creating and distributing your most confidential files.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


Bring the ultimate wireless printing solution to you home or small office. The PIXMA MX870 Wireless1 Home Office All-In-One lets you print from any room in your home and boasts incredible 9600 x 2400 maximum color dpi2 with tiny 1pl ink droplets and a 5 individual ink tank system. A built-in, fully integrated 35-sheet Auto Document Feeder means fast copying or scanning of your originals so you can tend to other tasks while the printer is at work. Its built-in Auto Duplex Printing prints 2-sided documents without having to manually flip the pages and can reduce your paper consumption by 50%. Combine both of those and you can automatically copy two sided documents without having to flip any paper manually at all. Additionally, various security features like password protected PDF’s let you feel safe about creating and distributing your most confidential files. 




View larger Super G3 High-speed Fax and networkable Ethernet ensure efficient communication and thanks to Dual Color Gamut Processing Technology, your copies will maintain the integrity of the original while you produce remarkable scans at 4800 dpi. This versatile Wireless Office All-In-One also prints photo lab quality pictures. So, utilize 2 Paper Paths to easily select printing documents on plain and pictures photo paper without having to load one paper at a time. Speaking of photos, take full advantage of Canon’s fantastic Wi-Fi printing technology and print your photos wirelessly from compatible iPhone 3G, 3GS and iPod touch devices with the new Easy-PhotoPrint for iPhone App, available for free on the app store11. Enjoy additional computer-less printing capabilities via compatible memory cards3, PictBridge and optional Bluetooth4 while images are easy viewed on a 2.5” LCD. 

Whether you’re running your business on a PC or Mac, the PIXMA MX870 meets all of your printing needs in one machine and can fit virtually anywhere! 


Speed & Quality
Extraordinary Resolution: Realize the power of 9600 x 2400 maximum color dpi firing with 1pl. Benefit? Incredible quality and detail in both your business documents and photos.

High Performance Individual Ink System: This 5-color ink system consists of four dye-based inks plus a pigment-based black ink, producing exceptional photos and crisp, laser-quality text. Only replace the color ink tank that runs out. So, you save money on ink



Bring the ultimate wireless printing solution to you home or small office.View largerEase of Use
Fully-Integrated Duplex Auto Document Feeder: The built-in 35-sheet Duplex Automatic Document Feeder (ADF) makes it easy to copy, scan or fax multiple documents without having to load them one at a time. Its full integration into the lid makes it easier to fit into tight spots and once it’s loaded it lets you do well, whatever you want. 

Built-In Auto Duplex Printing: Keep it green and automatically print and copy on both sides of the page without the hassle of turning it over manually. This saves you time, money and paper – plus you’re helping the environment! 

Easy Scroll Wheel: Easily and quickly access and select the various features available for faster operation. 

2.5” LCD Screen: Easily view, select and edit your images for simple computer-free printing. No downloading needed, just pick your pic and print! 

Dual Color Gamut Technology: Copy with confidence as this built-in technology automatically optimizes your originals so copies stay true to it time after time, copy after copy.

Auto Scan Mode:5 Automatically recognizes the type of original, then scans and saves the suitable settings. 

Quick Start: Powering up your printer is now faster than ever. After pressing the power button you can begin inputting commands in mere seconds. So, full operation is possible in a much shorter time. 

Auto Photo Fix II: This built-in technology automatically categorizes your images into one of five types − Portrait, Scenery, Night Scenery, Snapshot with Scenery, and Snapshot with Night Scenery − then applies optimal image and multi-zone exposure correction. So, unexposed areas of the photo will be optimized, area by area and faces that are backlit and under-exposed will automatically be brightened with correct color cast to help ensure more accurate skin tones for gorgeous images. 

2 Way Paper Feeding: To add to your options this feature lets you load paper from the front cassette or rear tray so whether your office or photo lab is open, you’re ready to print!




Fully Integrated Duplex Auto Document Feeder.View larger Connectivity
Built-In Wireless: Print or scan wirelessly from any Wi-Fi enabled computer around the house. 

Built-in Ethernet: This wired LAN interface lets you connect to a home or office network, with connected computers sharing the power of this versatile machine, each being able to display the printer’s status at any moment. 

Super G3 Fax: The business fax standard for color and PC facsimiles on plain paper meets the home office workhorse with 100 coded speed dials and up to 250 incoming pages6 to meet your every communication need. 

iPhone Printing: Take full advantage of Canon’s fantastic Wi-Fi printing technology to unlock, print and share your stored images right on the spot. Print your photos wirelessly from compatible iPhone 3G, 3GS and iPod touch models.

Memory Cards / USB / PictBridge & Optional Bluetooth: Don’t feel like using a computer? No problem. Just insert a compatible memory card into the built in card slot, select images on the LCD display, and print! Thanks to a PictBridge connection you can also print photos directly from your digital camera, DV camcorder or camera phone. Plus, you can print from the optional BU-30 wireless Bluetooth unit.

USB 2.0 Hi-Speed: Plug the cable into your PC for a super-fast connection for your data transfers. 




Print 11” x 14” from any of the 3-Way Paper Paths.View largerFeatures







What's in the Box?
PIXMA MX870 Wireless Office All-In-One Printer Cross Sell SheetGetting Started Important Information Sheet Network Setup Troubleshooting Read Before Setting Up the Machine Setup Software & User’s Guide CD-ROMWarranty Card PGI-220 (Pigment Black) CLI-221 (Black/Cyan/Magenta/Yellow) Power Cord Print Head Telephone Line Cable 





Disclaimers
1. Wireless printing requires a working Ethernet network with wireless 802.11b/g capability. Wireless performance may vary based on terrain and distance between the printer and wireless network clients.

2. Resolution may vary based on printer driver setting. Color ink droplets can be placed with a horizontal pitch of 1/9600 inch at minimum.

3. Compatible memory cards include SDTM Memory Card, SDHC,TM MultiMediaCard ® (v4.1), MultiMediaCard® Plus (v4.1), CompactFlash® Card, Microdrive,® Memory Stick,® Memory Stick PRO,TM Memory Stick DuoTM and Memory Stick PRO Duo.TM The following can be used with the addition of a special adapter sold separately: miniSDTM Card, miniSDHCTM, microSDTM Card, microSDHCTM, RS-MMCTM (v4.1), Memory Stick Micro, xD-Picture Card,® xD-Picture Card® (Type M), and xD-Picture Card® (Type H).

4. Requires mobile phone (or other device) equipped with Bluetooth v2.0 technology and optional Canon Bluetooth Unit BU-30. Bluetooth operation depends on the device and software version used. Operating distance is approx. 10 meters but may vary due to obstacles, radio signals, locations where radio interference occurs, magnetic fields from microwave ovens, device sensitivity and/or antenna performance..

5. For network users, Auto Scan Mode is only available when scanning at a computer using MP Navigator EX software and selecting the 1-click feature then “Save to PC.”

6. Page count is based on ITU-T No.1 chart or Canon FAX Standard Chart No.1.

7. “ISO/IEC 24734, 24735 define the default print and copy speed measurement methods. Print speeds are the averages of ESAT in Office Category Test for the default simplex mode, ISO/IEC 24734, excluding time to print the first set. Copy speed is the average of FCOT, ISO/IEC 24735 Annex D. ADF copy speed is the average of ESAT in General Performance Test for the default simplex mode, ISO/IEC 24735, excluding time to copy the first set.”

8. Photo print speeds are based on the standard mode driver setting using photo test pattern(s) and select Canon Photo Paper. Print speed is measured as soon as first page begins to feed into printer and will vary depending on system configuration, interface, software, document complexity, print mode, types of paper used and page coverage. 

9. Based on accelerated testing by Canon in dark storage under controlled temperature, humidity and gas conditions, simulating storage in an album with plastic sleeves. Canon cannot guarantee the longevity of prints; results may vary depending on printed image, drying time, display/storage conditions, and environmental factors.

10. Requires mobile phone equipped with PictBridge technology and a USB cable.
